data.title: Cilla! Episode guide?
data.meta_description: Where can one find an episode guide for her series? And what exists?
data.text:
Post by David Saunders on

Where can one find an episode guide for her series? And what exists?

From a past Missing Episodes Forum post, there may very well be more editions existing now, but here is information available from the time:

dubs

the Cilla thread starts here!!

Sat Dec 14 16:06:13 2002

Not holding much of interest according to Kal 95:

CILLA

Series 1

30/1/68 to 26/3/68

on TR16:

13/2/68 Frankie Vaughan, Donovan, Roy Hudd, Les Dawson

5/3/68 Cliff Richard - 1st song for Europe

12/3/68 Terry Scott, Hugh lloyd, Mike Yarwood, Sandie Shaw, Cliff Richard - 2nd song for Europe.

Series 2

24/12/68 to 19/2/69

on TR16:

12/2/69 Dusty Springfield, Georgie Fame

19/2/69 Cliff Richard, Dickie Henderson

Series 3

18/11/69 to 24/12/69 - all junked

Series 4

23/1/71 to 6/3/71 - all junked

Series 5

6/11/71 to 18/12/71

20/11/71 Sacha Distel, Michael Bentine, Howerd on Film (BBC/SFB co-prod.) - D3-PAL

27/11/71 Ringo Starr, Sven-Bertil Taube, Basil Brush, Howerd on Film (BBC/ABTV/TV2) - 1-PAL

11/12/71 Clive Dunn, Roger Cook, Roger Greenaway - CF16SEQ PO

Series 6

30/12/72 to 3/3/73

30/12/72 Alfred Marks, Donovan - D3-PAL

6/1/73 Leslie Crowther, Matt Munro, Ethel Merman - D3-PAL

13/1/73 Stephen Lewis, Cliff Richard - song for Europe 1 - D3-PAL

20/1/73 John Alderton, Cliff Richard - song for Europe 2 - D3-PAL

27/1/73 T Rex, Kenny Lynch, Cliff Richard - song for Europe 3 - 1-PAL

3/2/73 The World of Cilla, Cliff Richard - song for Europe 4 - 1-PAL

10/2/73 Frankie Howerd, Cliff Richard - song for Europe 5 - D3-PAL

17/2/73 Hannah Gordon, Cliff Richard - song for Europe 6 - 1-PAL

24/2/73 Song for Europe - all 6 songs - 1-PAL

3/3/73 Song for Europe - winner - 1-PAL

Series 7

5/1/74 to 2/3/74

5/1/74 Twiggy, Bernard Cribbins - D3-PAL

12/1/74 Peter Gilmore, Michael Bates 1-PAL

9/2/74 Mike & Bernie Winters, Vince Hill 2-PAL

16/2/74 Dick Emery, Mary Hopkin, Frank Bough, The Brothers Lee 2-PAL

2/3/74 Wilfred Pickles, George Layton, The Shadows 2-PAL

26/8/74 (no details) 2-PAL

26/12/74 Gerald Harper, Wombles, David Essex 2-PAL

Series 8

14/2/76 to 17/4/76 - all on D3-PAL

14/2/76 Peters & Lee, Jim Dale

21/2/76 Roy Hudd, Dana, Diana Dors

28/2/76 Bill Simpson, The Brothers Lee, Andy Williams

6/3/76 Jimmy Tarbuck, Keith Barron

13/3/76 Ronnie Corbett, Charles Aznavour

20/3/76 Mike & Bernie Winters

27/3/76 Tim Brook-Taylor, Joan Sims

10/4/76 Sach Distel, Mike Reid, The Janis Brothers

17/4/76 Alfred Marks, John Inman, Johnny Mathis

33 out of 68 produced.

Post by williammcgregor on

To save duplication I've only included artists or information not on David's previous post

Series One

30/01/68 Tom Jones and Cilla duet on "It's Not Unusual" also Roy Castle,New Kentucky Minstrels,Harry H.Corbett and Jimmy Edwards

06/02/68 Cilla duets with Ringo www.beatlesbible.com/1968/02/06/ringo-starr-cilla-black-television-show-appearance/ also Spike Milligan,Harry Secombe and ventriloquist Peter Brough.

13/02/68 Bruce Forsyth, Frankie Vaughan sang his song "Nevertheless"

20/02/68 Lulu,Dickie Henderson and Ray Fell

27/02/68 Matt Monro and Russ Conway

12/03/68 Cliff sang "Congratulations"

19/03/68 Scott Walker

26/03/68 Dudley Moore Trio (last of series one)

seemingly viewing figures were 13.5 million.

Series Two

24/12/68 Scott Walker 8pm

31/12/68 Matt Monro,Billy Cotton,Frankie Howard (Filmed in Scotland?) broadcast at 11pm.

22/01/69 Francoise Hardy,Peter Cook

29/01/69 Johnny Mathis,Sheila Hancock

05/02/69 Sacha Distel,Una Stubbs

More to follow once I look at some more NME's etc.

Post by Alan Turrell on

It is on Lost shows.

The problem i have is when you type in Cilla! it comes up Your search string "cilla" has produced too many results. Try adding some additional words to make it more specific.

You type in Cilla Black it comes up Your search string "cilla black" has produced too many results. Try adding some additional words to make it more specific.

You type in Cilla Black Show No matches found.

So not sure how you find the info on them .

Post by williammcgregor on

This appears to be missing ? ...

Cilla BBC 1

Series 7

19.01.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Bill Owen, Kenneth McKellar

The only known complete copy was recorded on a domestic video format (e.g. VHS, Beta, Philips 1500).

26.01.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Joe Brown, Milo O'Shea, Design

The only known complete copy was recorded on a domestic video format (e.g. VHS, Beta, Philips 1500).

02.02.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Gerald Harper, Tony Blackburn, The Sweet (missing)

23.02.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Gerald Harper, Tony Blackburn, Bryan Ferry (missing)

02.03.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Wilfred Pickles, George Layton, The Shadows (missing)

Post by Ray Langstone (was saintsray) on

This appears to be missing ? ...

Cilla BBC 1

Series 7

19.01.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Bill Owen, Kenneth McKellar

The only known complete copy was recorded on a domestic video format (e.g. VHS, Beta, Philips 1500).

26.01.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Joe Brown, Milo O'Shea, Design

The only known complete copy was recorded on a domestic video format (e.g. VHS, Beta, Philips 1500).

02.02.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Gerald Harper, Tony Blackburn, The Sweet (missing)

23.02.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Gerald Harper, Tony Blackburn, Bryan Ferry (missing)

02.03.1974 With Cilla Black, The Breakaways, Wilfred Pickles, George Layton, The Shadows (missing)

Bloomin' eck! William, congrats on finding this!

Adding it to the list of finds for 2020, with credit....
